isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Place the larger low range synchronizer ring on the bench. Cover the assembly with a shop rag to prevent losing the three springs released from the high range synchronizer at the pin locations. Pull the high range synchronizer from the blocker pins ( Figure 106).

figure.caption: Figure 106. Pull High Range Synchronizer From Blocker Pins

step1.para: Remove the sliding clutch from the synchronizer low range pins ( Figure 107).

figure.caption: Figure 107. Remove Sliding Clutch From Synchronizer Low Range Pins

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies

step1.para: Use the front face of the deep reduction gear as a base and press the output shaft through the bearing and gear ( Figure 108). This frees the bearing, reduction gear, washer, and the splined washer.

figure.caption: Figure 108. Press Output Shaft Through Bearing and Gear

step1.para: Remove the reduction gear washer, reduction gear and the splined washer from the shaft ( Figure 109).

figure.caption: Figure 109. Remove Reduction Gear Washer, Reduction Gear and Splined Washer

step1.para: Remove the rear bearing cover retaining bolts, rear bearing cover and the gasket from the auxiliary housing ( Figure 110). The rear bearing cone drops from the housing bore when the cover is removed. If necessary, replace the oil seal on the rear bearing cover (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 110. Remove Rear Bearing Cover Retaining Bolts, Rear Bearing Cover and Gasket

step1.para: Remove the complete bearing race from the bearing bore ( Figure 111).

figure.caption: Figure 111. Remove Complete Bearing Race From Bearing Bore
